Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2012 07:15AM tammie wrote: Karen I too have been experiencing horrible (scary) headaches shoulder hip and back pain since early June.. I completed chemo in March and started arimadex, I've been on zometa monthly  since last Sept.... I can now safely say ive had every scan under the sun in the past month and a half... My PET/CT scan just came back showing great results that my tx is working when compared to the scan done last Nov. in fact my CT was barely able to show the mets in my liver!! All of this news is awesome of course but odd i been so fatigued and in pain quite often?? My Onc. can only conclude since the necrotic bone is appearing to be more dense that its my body tryin to heal the bone.. As for pain management i take 15mgs of extended release morpihine twice a day and recently do to uptake in pain am now taking 3 a day and it does take care of the pain perhaps if you find yourself needing pain meds so often you could try an extended release.. I love it because i hate the dopey feeling i get from pain meds and with these i dont ever have that in fact if it werent for the constipation id never even know i was taking morphine lol.. I responded to this as it sounded soo much like what ive been going through..Keeping my fingers crossed its the arimadex or possibly healing bone.. big hugs to you and hoping it lets up for you soon..Tammie

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2014 08:55PM tammie wrote: our stories sound similar I fought stage IIb in 2002 and thought I was done.. In sept. Of 2011 I was diagnosed stage IV with mets to almost every bone in my body skull to toes and mets to both lobes of my liver and several lymph nodes in my chest.. I've burned through many anti hormonals, I've seen some women go years on one anti hormonal and others burn through them like water, we all seem to differ in that.. About a year ago things went nuts for me and the bones and liver were growing like crazy and I had new progression to my rt lung and brain.. I then had a successful gamma procedure to my brain and was put on Xeloda an oral form of chemo.. Here I am a year later still on Xeloda but all mets to lung are dead and for the first time since diagnosis the mets to liver are fully dead (best they ever held was stable) and a bunch of the bone mets have died off with many reducing in size.. There's no way to know exactly what path your treatment will take as we all vary.. As for remission my oncologist told me with as many bone mets as I have the best I should hope for is stable.. I have learned as many on this very board told me when I first came to stage IV boards that stage IV doesn't have to be a death sentence and there are many treatments and options out there for us.. I hope arimadex works for you for a very long time... Hugs to you and welcome

Posts.Content: tammie wrote: I dont mean to be a winer, or sound ridiculous when so many of you have been fightin for much longer some with a far worse prognosis than me.. My 20 yr old daughter whos a full time student with a 1 yr. old daughter texted me from work yesterday asking if since i was doing so much better did the Drs. still say i was going to die.. She was there at dx when Dr. doom and gloom informed me things were grim and i probably had a yr left.. It broke my heart to tell her that my dx hadnt changed but i did feel that i should have more than a yr but couldnt say how long.Gave her the whole line about enjoying the good times and dealing with the bad when they come..After quite a lengthy discussion i THINK i had her feeling more positive about the situation.. Today my 15 yr old whos been behaving like a little trooper through this past month which has had me waitin for the other shoe to drop as hes a quiet little guy who keeps alot in finally with no warning barged into my room saying we should talk.. He says he feels like i just walk around acting like everythings fine and acting all happy even though i know that im going to die!! I was floored!! Safe to say the other shoe dropped alright right on my damn head thats for sure.. After lengthy discussion some tears and a quick tour of the internet to look at my disease and the fact that some people fight for yrs he seemed to be a little more confidant that i clearly have some more time left and it may be a good idea to be happy and enjoy as much as we can right now..Needless to say much like probably every other mom out there now that i have them put back together some im now tore up..I HATE THIS DAMN DISEASE!! I been tryin to keep it together ive got scans on tues. for pet/ct and also doing a  brain MRI due to headaches and little round lumps behind my earlobe any1 ever experience this? I already know theres a small lesion in my liver..But i have a bad feelin bout these lumps showing up now behind ear and keep fearing the worst..I'm sorry for wining ladies but i could desprately use some advice and support here..Definately having one of those days where i cant seem to find the light at the end of the tunnel..Get so frustrated at times i just wanna throw in the towel i hate seeing our families go through what they endure do to this nasty a** disease its just not right..Much love and sorry for wining yet again i just cant take this sh** anymore its too much!! Thank you all for being hee any advice or pointers much appreciated.. (((HUGS))) Tammie Everytime the wheel turns round bound to cover just a little more ground!! Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2012 11:25PM tammie wrote: Spamgirl i was dx'ed 8mo. ago and was told a year if i was lucky.. Well I believe that Onc.'s about to eat her words, not that i will see her again but tempted to send her a card lol.. I'm 10mo. in and still gettin around as well as i was a year ago... I have too many lesions to count starting with 3 in my skull and ending in my toes , i also have many small lesions in my liver..It amazes me everytime i veiw a bone scan that im up and feeling soo good.. I dont believe any of us have an expiration date.. I too was very occupied in the beginning feeling like i had this time stamp hanging over me but as times gone on ive come to realize im very likely to have in the worse case scenerio at least several yrs and hoping to even defy that ;) My i ask where your mets are and what tx your doing? I'm currently on arimadex and zometa only, but the last bone scan showing the bones are flaring up again so fear it may be back to chemo or some other tx to slow it back down.. But honestly i live a pretty productive life..A wise women from these boards told me when i first started this path to never ever let anyone put an expiration date on me, and to get up everyday and live it to the fullest! This is  a crazy roller coaster ride, that we are stuck on...Its full of many dips and twists, and can at times leave you spinning!! But the biggest dips are worth every minute we get to enjoy in the sunshine..Big hugs to you.. AND most importantly never forget we dont come with time stamps or expiration dates.. :)

Then you lift up high as the sky and feel phew i conquered that one without vomitting only to have it dip super fast and often upside down and out of control again, always hoping for the ride to end without making me vomit.. The only difference now I dread that crazy ride coming to an end as I know it  will mean the end of ME and all I still feel I want to accomplish in this life!! So i continue to ride on praying the ride will give me just one more smooth section of track in which i can pull that pit from my stomach and the ride conductor will let me go just one more time without getting off and having to wait in line again.. Most importantly Thanks to all you ladies here for riding with me as i've no clue how i could handles those big dips without you all to cheer me on! <3 this thread hugs to you all.. Tammie

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 08:11AM tammie wrote: Welcome and as many have said sorry you had to join us here... I'm sure as you can see theres lots of support and information here... I've been stage IV for a year now with inemerable mets to almost every bone in my body an inumerable (i hate that word now lol) mets to both lobes of my liver... I remember when I first heard the diagnosis I couldnt even begin to wrap my head around it, I felt like Alice in wonderland and was in that deep dark hole... When i first came back to these boards i thought my life was over and these ladies picked me up and dusted me off so to speak and before i knew it I was moving forward..  I'm 42 with 4 children my youngest has just turned 16 .. If you ever need a friend to talk to or bounce questions off of feel free to message me any time.. Also try to remember you are not alone and as difficult as the first months of this can be dont ever lose hope.. Some advice dont read statistics their false, research your treatments and always remember if not comfortable with your Dr. theres plenty out there... I just past the one year mark a couple weeks ago and the stupid Dr. that diagnosed me gave me 1 year tops and im actually more healthy today than I was a year ago, thanks to the guidance here I fired Dr. Jerk and am doing great... Big big hugs to you we are all here when you need us dont doubt that... Tammy

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2012 01:44PM tammie wrote: My understanding of stable which is were ive been fortuntely since March, is that theres still evidence of disease but no current growth, NED is when theres no evidence of disease in your scans,and ive been told for those lucky enough to go 5yrs NED you are then considered to be in remission.. hope that helps you some ;) As for the work subject its definately something i feel VERY strongly on.. I was pulled immediately upon stage IV dx and was forced onto SSDI.. Its been a full year now and there are times I still grieve for my job I miss the feeling of having a purpose and I actually unlike many loved my job.. However one year out I dont know how I ever did both and actually feel pretty fulfilled (sp) in my new life as I call it.. Dont get me wrong i wish often I could be done with all this and just have my old life back, but I have come to love this new one i've made for myself.. Not to mention when all is said and done the time i've spent and had available for my family in this past year has become priceless to me.. Given current circumstances I wouldnt trade that time for anything in the world.. In the end it is really a personal decision and you need to do whats best for you and makes you happiest.. Doubt I was of much help on that lmao.. If you find yourself to bored or wanting to put more into community or whatever look into hobbies or volunteer work to fill some time that may even give you an idea as to how much stamina you have and you will also feel your accomplishing something.. Big hugs to you and im also sure your family and DH feel you contribute plenty.. ;)

Posts.Content: tammie wrote: So as I posted my happy update the other day l went today for my PET results and to meet with my Onc. whos finally back after going through a terrible auto accident.. So i have gamma set up for Mon. for this new brain met and one area of the skull they believes putting pressure on my brain.. My onc. although horrified and angry i was told not only did i have brain met but liver no longer stable and spots to both lungs on top of severe bone uptake was happy they were wrong.. We discussed my starting Xeloda two days after my gamma knife next week.. He then appologized for not reading pet scan as was his 1st day back and we could read it together.. WELL it seems my liver is taking off again ive got spots with high activity in all 3 lobes of the right lung, my bones havnt just doubled in size but theres a ton of new ones.. My Onc. seemed quite shocked ive never seen him soo upset as was I.. I left there with my head spinning it seems after thinking all was well its back to mets everywheres again.. Have any of you ladies here dealt with mets to so many areas and had positive outcomes to reahing stable again? I'm soo lost and scared right now.. Bone,liver,brain and lungs!! How can i fight this back?? I'm determined to give it my all but im petrified <3 Everytime the wheel turns round bound to cover just a little more ground!! Posts.Title: Out of remission, now my son has cancer mcbird edwh001

Posts.Content: tammie wrote: As many of you may remember my 16yr. old suffered a psychotic breakdown of some sort and was transferred to a facility 3hrs from our home..We have been here for a full month tomorrow.. The first med. they tried brought no success and this week by about mid week we should know if this new one will work.. I've been fortunate to have a place called Amanda's house here that works like ronald mcdonald house and is free for me to stay at which has been a life saver.. I cant say its been an easy month by any means.. I wake every morning and drive 40min. to visit him then 40min. back to an empty house that although nice isnt home and sit read, t.v., and basically climb the walls till soon after dinner i make the drive again to arrive and see my son who doesnt seem much like my son anymore most days he tells me i should go home my visits are preventing him from doin program and without doing program he says he cant get his dispatch papers and he wants to come home, these are actually the clear moments..Most of my visits consist of trying to make conversation with him while he mumbles to himself occasionally making weird noises in his demon/soul battle, he occasionally engages with me throughout the visit about whats going on at home or asks about his dog.. But unfortunately most of his lengthy conversations consist of him telling me to get my palleds out of him they my duds put there or some crazy story about the demon wanting his Mcdonalds etc... I feel like im in an endless hole thats just swallowing me up i go home for weekends and try to catch up some with the family and the visits are far too short to accomplish much and then i'm back in my daily routine of horror and heartache.. My son is in a wonderful facility, i must say as far as mental hospitals go i now know why theyr considered the best in the state and theyv made this hell as tolerable as it possibly can be for both him and myself.. However I just cant take nomore i dont even know what i feel inside other than empty heartache, it hurts to be here hurts more when im not here to see him and make sure hes o.k. everyday.. Not to mention im going broker than broke.. I'm drivin a little over 80 miles a day 2 visit alone then 156 miles home on fri. but have to give my truck to my EX so he can get here for weekends so Aron's not alone as ive no car then get a ride 156 miles back up to get my truck its over 1000 miles a week on average that ive been putting on this poor lil SUV... Sorry i'm here wining again I'm trying to stay positive and just keep pluggin on knowing theres gotta be an end to this loong dark tunnel i been lost in for weeks, but it gets so lonely here and i cant help but wonder at times is my lil guy ever going to come back to me.. Seems a year ago when I was given a year to live my biggest fear was not seeing him graduate high school,now today i'd give anything to just see him come back to reality again!! Thank you all for listening and sorry again I know this is not on topic at all but i needed to vent someplace i feel understood... Everytime the wheel turns round bound to cover just a little more ground!! Posts.Content: tammie wrote: So I been in the hospital since Thurs am due to extreme rib and back pain... Well the Ct scan results came in showing a growth in my right lung measuring 5cm...In March the lungs were clear n showing nothing at all.. The weird thing is my liver and bone mets are all appearing to be stable... Even more ironic yet is that all of my mets have always been teeny tiny and everywhere, for example the largest of my inumerable mets in bone or liver measures 1.2 cm n thats the one in the liver too close to the heart for biopsy.. I was sick for 2 weeks with laryngitis and horrible cough in fact just last week i was at ER with fever but they discharged me without so much as bloodwork or anything saying laryngitis and a cold.. Soo with that said im prayin that this growth in my lung is actually infection, onc. seems to feel thats also possible doesnt want to discharge me as he says can get biopsy quicker if im inpatient as ill have priority.. Honestly ladies i'm scared to death and although tryin very hard to be positive feeling that lung mets on top of bone n liver is gonna way decrease my life.. Not to mention 5 freaking cm's thats huge n grew very fast as 10 weeks ago lungs were crystal clear..Any pointers or similiar stories please chime in.. I dont know how to handle all this im scared to death, things been going so well n i been gaining strength... Dont know what to do from here or where to turn :'( Everytime the wheel turns round bound to cover just a little more ground!! The week has drug on back on the rollercoaster were one minute im confidant n resolved this lung things just a scare, then the next im fearing what if?? Posts.Title: Checking in tammie Boo123

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2012 11:22AM tammie wrote: Monica i hope your treatments go well... I do so remember how lost i was in the beginning of all this and trying to find a routine seemed impossible my mind was flitting everywhere.. Prior to the whole stage IV crap i lived a very normal structured life... My anxiety was through the roof for the first few months post dx and beginning treatment... My youngest is 15 and upon dx i inherited my oldest and two of the granbabies with a third on the way, to put it simple it was just plain crazy here...I'm now 6 months into this whole process have completed some rads to spine and 4 runs of A/C as this crap has moved into the liver,ONC is now moving me onto xeloda (oral chemo).. I have to say my home routine has changed a total 360 from what it was, however we have all adjusted and i can say we are closer than ever... As for anxiety there are days that mine goes through the roof and others where i seem to forget i even have cancer (those r the best days and i take advantage of them)... If you find however that your unable to get the anxiety under control or feel depression creeping in and not leaving theres no shame in trying anti-depressants or seeking some counceling... I'm here if you ever need a friend to chat with or an ear to vent to this is a tough path in life but it does seem less bumpy once you begin to travel it..I've come to see it as a new way of life and refuse to let it knock me down...Big hugs to you and your family...Tammie

I've been fortunate to have a place called Amanda's house here that works like ronald mcdonald house and is free for me to stay at which has been a life saver.. I cant say its been an easy month by any means.. I wake every morning and drive 40min. to visit him then 40min. back to an empty house that although nice isnt home and sit read, t.v., and basically climb the walls till soon after dinner i make the drive again to arrive and see my son who doesnt seem much like my son anymore most days he tells me i should go home my visits are preventing him from doin program and without doing program he says he cant get his dispatch papers and he wants to come home, these are actually the clear moments..Most of my visits consist of trying to make conversation with him while he mumbles to himself occasionally making weird noises in his demon/soul battle, he occasionally engages with me throughout the visit about whats going on at home or asks about his dog.. But unfortunately most of his lengthy conversations consist of him telling me to get my palleds out of him they my duds put there or some crazy story about the demon wanting his Mcdonalds etc... I feel like im in an endless hole thats just swallowing me up i go home for weekends and try to catch up some with the family and the visits are far too short to accomplish much and then i'm back in my daily routine of horror and heartache.. My son is in a wonderful facility, i must say as far as mental hospitals go i now know why theyr considered the best in the state and theyv made this hell as tolerable as it possibly can be for both him and myself.. However I just cant take nomore i dont even know what i feel inside other than empty heartache, it hurts to be here hurts more when im not here to see him and make sure hes o.k. everyday.. Not to mention im going broker than broke.. I'm drivin a little over 80 miles a day 2 visit alone then 156 miles home on fri. but have to give my truck to my EX so he can get here for weekends so Aron's not alone as ive no car then get a ride 156 miles back up to get my truck its over 1000 miles a week on average that ive been putting on this poor lil SUV... Sorry i'm here wining again I'm trying to stay positive and just keep pluggin on knowing theres gotta be an end to this loong dark tunnel i been lost in for weeks, but it gets so lonely here and i cant help but wonder at times is my lil guy ever going to come back to me.. Seems a year ago when I was given a year to live my biggest fear was not seeing him graduate high school,now today i'd give anything to just see him come back to reality again!! Thank you all for listening and sorry again I know this is not on topic at all but i needed to vent someplace i feel understood... Everytime the wheel turns round bound to cover just a little more ground!! Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 04:33PM tammie wrote: I first found the boards in Dec. 2002 right after starting chemo for my first dx at the age of 32...Was stage llb IDC..Did lumpectomy,12 weekly taxol,8weeks rads, and then oopherctomy..The boards gave me a wealth of support and i made several close relationships with a few of the girls here... I stopped coming as much after losing several of them long after my tx... Well in Sept 2011 severe back pain brought me to the ER and i was dx'ed with bone mets and admitted to the hospital for several days for scans etc., discovered i had inumerable mets from my skull to my toes..Soo back to the boards i ran..Ive done 10 rads to lower spine and neck and was put on tamoxifen and monthly Zometa..Then in nov. 2011 disccovered the little buggers invaded my liver..My first ONC was horrible and ive since got a new one..I'm now doing 4 rounds of A/C.. After 3 attempts to get a biopsy with no success my ONC feels the chemo is more impotant..Apparently i have inumerable diffuse mets to liver which are tiny making it difficult to get a piece of..My original path was highly er/pr + her2 - invasive IDC, scares me that still cant get a piece of it as after 9 yrs who knows and deep down id like to know what it is that im battling..the boards have been priceless source of information and support to me..Honestly the ONC i fired would have probly killed me were it not for the information i recieved here.. I have 4 children from age 24-15, and im about to have my 4th grandbaby (they need to slow down).. I was 2 yrs out of divorce at the time of stage lv dx and ironically had my first dinner date scheduled for the very day i was admitted to the hospital n told bone mets.. Thanks to many of you here after several months of hiding n thinkin the world was gonna end i got the courage to go on that date..So i now have a wonderful man that i spend weekends with that has even taken me for my liver biopsy n last chemo..My oldest son his wife and children have moved back home from California to be here with me, we have the house remodel almost done so we can coexist more comfortably..they have been a big help with both the bills and my 15yr old not to mention the granbabies being soo close helps keep me going..Thanks and love to all of you for being here your support n friendship is priceless to me... Tammie

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2012 08:24PM tammie wrote: Soo sorry I too remember the way my head was spinning after 10yrs cancer free to discover it was back and all over the place in my bones and into the liver too... TRY to take a deep breath and give yourself a minute to get your feet under you.. I discovered bone mets can be kept in check quite well.. I would ask when they are starting zometa or xgeva as sandilee suggested that was the first med i was put on also.. Its so overwhelming to take in at first.. I have to say honestly that this past 10 months for me have been no picnic it has changed my life in manys ways, but i've been blessed with a great quality of life this far and keep hope that it will continue for a long time... I hope that whatever tx you go into gives you great success... My advice on whats next is to take a minute to catch your breath, do your research into whats out there and dont look at statistics i dont know where they get them from but they are seriously inaccurate from what ive seen... As for the family thats the hardest task.. I've been honest with my grown kids and several of them have even assisted me in my researching my disease and are at times my biggest cheerleader... The motto amongst my children is my cancer affects us all and therefore they have a right to know as little or as much as they want to know.. Soo sorry you had to come back here but welcome back.. Sending big hugs and feel free to come as often as you need we are always here... (((hugs))) Tammie
